message: The COMPARABILITY field for indicator 2-2-1, translated into en
data:
The indicator “Rate of malnourished children under 5 years old” of Vietnam corresponds to 02 international indicators:

- 2.2.1 Prevalence of stunting (height for age <-2 standard deviation from the median of the World Health Organization (WHO) Child Growth Standards) among children under 5 years of age stunting (height for age <-2 standard deviation from WHO mean));

- 2.2.2 Prevalence of malnutrition (weight for height >+2 or <-2 standard deviation from the median of the WHO Child Growth Standards) among children under 5 years of age, by type (wasting and overweight) (Tỷ lệ trẻ em dưới 5 tuổi suy dinh dưỡng (cân nặng theo chiều cao> + or <-2 standard deviations based on WHO median for child growth standards)

“Rate of undernourished children under 5 years old” is a national statistical indicator thus ensuring comparability with international data/standards.
